intro: Astronia rugosa, commonly known as the rough astronia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wetlands and along riverbanks, thriving in moist, tropical environments. Astronia rugosa is often used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
